comment: This was the worst teacher I have ever come across. She can not teach; she was very disrespectful, and she accused us of using AI while using it herself. She was a heavy grader on every little thing. This is from me to you all. If you want to drop your GPA or fail a class, take hers because she will get the job done.  AGAIN WORST TEACHER EVER.

This class was extremely disappointing! A ton of written assignments that she would accuse multiple students of using AI. One girl wrote two sentences and she was accused of using chat gpt and was reported. This class was very stressful with 2-5 quizzes a week plus a book reading and textbook work and a discussion post. The only C I've ever gotten.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Get ready to read. 3-5 20 question quizzes each week as well as discussion posts. She will accuse you of AI a lot and often. Make sure you use a Google Doc because you will have to argue that you are using your own words. Final is worth 30% of your grade. Memorize the quizzes you are taking as you take them.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Reece is a great professor, and this class was enjoyable! Read the academic journal articles. They help you do well in discussion posts and assignments and are interesting. Dr. Reece gives great feedback on assignments and is always available to answer any questions. Wish she was teaching more classes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: I cannot express how disappointed I am to have had Dr. Reece as a professor. She is very unforgiving and inconsiderate even if you're a millisecond late or do not follow her rubric to a T. I had a death in my family and she was insensitive about it and disallows any room for error. If you are a human I recommend you do your senior seminar elsewhere
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: She is a great professor. Professor Churchwell is communicative and well organized in every aspect. Most of her assignments were difficult and forced me to think deeper than any other teacher during my time at KSU. Professor Churchwell is by far one of the best professors I have had since beginning college.

Dr. Reece was by far my favorite professor in my college career so far. Her ability to push her students in a direction that will benefit them in her class and future academic endeavors is like none other. She is a tough grader but it streams for pure love and optimism that her toughness will advance her students. I loveee Dr.Reece!
Not difficult. Just read the book and you will do fine. She is a slow grader sometimes, but she will update you if you reach out.
I don't understand all of the bad reviews. My class seemed to do well and although she did require a paper, she helps a long the way.

Overall, was a meh professor. The journal entries seem impossible to get a good grade on. The quizzes are based on niche things from the textbook, as well as an extreme amount of typos throughout. I thought I'd be able to get an A but after receiving my first grade from the journal entries I realized that wasn't possible.

She was not fair at all. I would even go to the extreme of saying she is an awful professor who doesn't care about the success of her students. This is interesting in the case of her being a Senior Seminar teacher. She is a late grader and does not provide clear instructions. (Cont)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: This professor is awful. She does not seem to care in private meetings, does not throughly answer questions, and makes you feel like you have no idea what you are talking about. I did well in the class, but she speaks to you like she is running a daycare. She barely gives any feedback and seems to inconsistently grade. BEWARE!!!!!!!!!

very thorough feedback on assignments know APA format she's a stickler multiple extra credit opportunities Mid/final are papers it's a weekly discussion 4 papers one book review on a book list she provides 2 textbooks 2 zoom call class meetings to check-in Took as an undergrad and it was challenging but felt like I was finally learning

Grading is inconsistent received As on the discussion post but a C/ D on the midterm and final. How does that make sense? Subjective grading of exams no clear rubric. Be familiar with APA.This class was a lot of work and challenging. Told me I was doing good but why did she give me low exam scores. I worked really hard in this class and had a 4.0.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers
